response_parsed.title: Implementing Edge Runtimes with FastAPI in Python 3.12+
response_parsed.summary: This guide provides a comprehensive overview on how to utilize FastAPI, along with Python 3.12+, to create edge runtimes for efficient and modern web applications.
key_points: FastAPI is a modern, high-performance web framework for building APIs in Python.
Python 3.12+ provides additional features that enhance FastAPI's capabilities.
Edge runtimes allow deploying microservices and APIs closer to the end user for improved performance.
This guide focuses on using FastAPI for creating edge runtimes with Python 3.12+.

code_examples.code:
from fastapi import FastAPI, Depends
from sqlalchemy.ext.declarative import declared_attr
# Database model and CRUD operations omitted for brevity
@declared_attr
def label(obj):
    return obj.id
app = FastAPI()
db = Database()
dependency = lambda: db
@app.get("/items/{item_id}")
async def get_item(item_id: int, db=Depends(dependency)):
    item = await db.get_item(item_id)
    return item

version_notes: Python 3.12+ offers various improvements such as improved type hints, f-strings, and async context managers which are utilized in the provided code examples.
FastAPI version 0.70.0 or higher is recommended for this tutorial.
caveats: Ensure your development environment includes FastAPI and Python 3.12+.
For a more in-depth understanding, explore the official FastAPI documentation: https://fastapi.tiangolo.com/
This example assumes the use of a SQLAlchemy database for data persistence.
